Paragraph: As of jQuery 1.5, the success callback function is also passed a "jqXHR" object (in jQuery 1.4, it was passed the XMLHttpRequest object). However, since JSONP and cross-domain GET requests do not use XHR,  in those cases the jqXHR and textStatus parameters passed to the success callback are undefined.
Example: $.get( "ajax/test.html", function( data ) {  $( ".result" ).html( data );  alert( "Load was performed." );});

Paragraph: As of jQuery 1.5, all of jQuery's Ajax methods return  a superset of the XMLHTTPRequest object. This jQuery XHR object, or "jqXHR," returned by $.get() implements the Promise interface, giving it all the properties, methods, and behavior of a Promise (see Deferred object for more information). The jqXHR.done() (for success), jqXHR.fail() (for error), and jqXHR.always() (for completion, whether success or error; added in jQuery 1.6) methods take a function argument that is called when the request terminates. For information about the arguments this function receives, see the jqXHR Object section of the $.ajax() documentation.
Example: // Assign handlers immediately after making the request,// and remember the jqxhr object for this requestvar jqxhr = $.get( "example.php", function() {  alert( "success" );})  .done(function() {    alert( "second success" );  })  .fail(function() {    alert( "error" );  })  .always(function() {    alert( "finished" );  }); // Perform other work here ... // Set another completion function for the request abovejqxhr.always(function() {  alert( "second finished" );});

Paragraph: Request the test.php page, but ignore the return results.
Request the test.php page and send some additional data along (while still ignoring the return results).
Alert the results from requesting test.php (HTML or XML, depending on what was returned).
Alert the results from requesting test.cgi with an additional payload of data (HTML or XML, depending on what was returned).
Example: $.get( "test.cgi", { name: "John", time: "2pm" } )  .done(function( data ) {    alert( "Data Loaded: " + data );  });

Paragraph: Get the test.php page contents, which has been returned in json format ("John","time"=>"2pm" ) ); ?>), and add it to the page.
Get another page on the same domain. Outputs to console both the data returned and the type of data returned.
Example: // If this was sent on https://api.jquery.com/jQuery.get/ you will// get the response result of https://api.jquery.com/jQuery.ajax/$.get( "/jQuery.ajax/", function( data ) {  console.log( typeof data ); // string  console.log( data ); // HTML content of the jQuery.ajax page});
